data.event: In 1855, European explorers noted that there numbered over 6000 individuals of the Cowlitz Tribe.

event.title: was founded by Peter W. Crawford, a Scottish surveyor, who, in 1847

data.event: Kelso was founded by Peter W. Crawford, a Scottish surveyor, who, in 1847, took up the first donation land claim on the Lower Cowlitz River.

event.title: was dated and filed in October 1884

data.event: The original plat was dated and filed in October 1884.
In its early days, Kelso obtained the nickname "Little Chicago" as it became famous for its large number of taverns and brothels that catered to local loggers.
